入.definition: to enter; to go into; to join; to become a member of; (bound form) to conform to (as in 入時|入时[ru4shi2]); abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4sheng1]; (on product packaging, after {number n} + {classifier}) containing (n pieces) (from Japanese 入 "iri")

入不敷出.definition: income does not cover expenditure; unable to make ends meet

入世.definition: to engage with secular society; to involve oneself in human affairs; to join the WTO (abbr. for 加入世界貿易組織|加入世界贸易组织[jia1 ru4 Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zu3 zhi1])

入主.definition: to invade and take control of (a territory); to take the helm at (an organization); (of a company) to take control of (another company)

入伍.definition: to enter the army; to enlist

入伙.definition: to join a group; to become a member

入住.definition: to check in (at a hotel etc)

入味.definition: tasty; to be absorbed in sth; interesting

入圍.definition: to get past the qualifying round; to make it to the finals

入圍者.definition: finalist; qualifier; person or item selected as one of the best

入園.definition: to enter a park or other place for public recreation (typically, one whose name ends in 園|园: a zoo 動物園|动物园[dong4 wu4 yuan2], amusement park 遊樂園|游乐园[you2 le4 yuan2] etc); to enrol in a kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园[you4 er2 yuan2]; to start going to kindergarten

入團.definition: to enroll in the Communist Youth League

入土為安.definition: buried and at rest (idiom); Resquiescat in pacem (RIP)

入場.definition: to enter the venue for a meeting; to enter into an examination; to enter a stadium, arena etc

入境問俗.definition: When you enter a country, enquire about the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do; When in Rome, do as the Romans do

入境隨俗.definition: lit. when you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); fig. when in Rome, do as the Romans do

入學.definition: to enter a school or college; to go to school for the first time as a child

入學率.definition: percentage of children who enter school

入局.definition: to enter the game; to get involved; to walk into a scam

入微.definition: down to the smallest detail; thoroughgoing; fine and detailed

入戲.definition: (of an actor) to inhabit one's role; to become the character; (of an audience) to get involved in the drama

入戶.definition: to enter sb's house; to obtain a residence permit

入手.definition: to begin (with ...) (typically used in a structure such as 從|从[cong2] + {noun} + 入手[ru4 shou3]: "to begin with {noun}; to take {noun} as one's starting point"); to receive; to obtain; to buy

入會.definition: to join a society, association etc

入月.definition: (of women) beginning of menstrual cycle; full-term gestation

入木三分.definition: written in a forceful hand; penetrating; profound

入殮.definition: to put dead body in coffin

入獄.definition: to go to jail; to be sent to prison

入眼.definition: to appear before one's eyes; pleasing to the eye; nice to look at

入神.definition: to be enthralled; to be entranced

入籍.definition: to become naturalized; to become a citizen

入聯.definition: to join an alliance; admission to the United Nations

入聲.definition: entering tone; checked tone; one of the four tones of Middle Chinese

入職.definition: to commence employment; to enter a company

入贅.definition: to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family

入迷.definition: to be fascinated; to be enchanted

入道.definition: to enter the Way; to become a Daoist

入選.definition: to be included among those selected for

入鄉隨俗.definition: When you enter a village, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do; When in Rome, do as the Romans do

入門.definition: entrance door; to enter a door; to learn the basics of a subject; introduction (to a subject); (attributive) entry-level

入關.definition: to enter a pass; to go through customs

入關學.definition: theory proposed in 2019 on Chinese social media, centering on the idea of China replacing the United States as the dominant nation in a new world order, drawing an analogy with the Manchu overthrow of the Ming dynasty, achieved after the Qing army entered China via the Shanhai Pass 入關|入关[ru4 guan1]

入院.definition: to enter hospital; to be hospitalized

入黨.definition: to join a political party (esp. the Communist Party)
